Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice ...without 'hills' to climb”
Reviews.Author: rtdFirenze_Italy
Reviews.Content: On a family visit for the holidays. Staying here for the ease of getting to us without the climb. Always loyal to a Marriott when visiting San Francisco, but first time at JW. The location as others have commented is central; rooms are 'standard' but with many amentities such as upscale bath products, two full length bathrobes and as others have also commented....try to get a corner room for the extra size. This one that we are in is on what they call the club level since husband is a Platinum but they use for gold members as well if there is room. It is the service that is outstanding here, twice a day maid, refrigerator installed when requested, offer to change rooms if we did not like the one assigned...that kind of thing. Wonderful concierge (and in this regard we are very partial to Ric at the Stanford Court, our usual mainstay...but it is equally excellent here). The club lounge is wonderful. They supply little bags that if you prefer to take your food upstairs or wherever, you may do so. Also, lounge is open for breakfast SEVEN DAYS A WEEK. This is very unusual in United States. Selection is very good as is food preparation for the breakfast, stopped in to look at the dinner offerings when we arrived and also looked very nice. Desserts are extensive and this we did try last evening about 9 ....literally 6 or 7 choices and room for you to sit and chat comfortably and look out at a very lovely view. We are without a car but took the Super Shuttle here in 20 minutes time for 40.00 including gratituty for two persons. There are very good restaurants and obviously great shopping or browsing in this area that can be done without having to take a taxi. We are here a few times a year and in season you simply cannot depend on that cable car to get up the hills, the lines are l hour long at times and taxis are not all over. So, if you are here and want a good solid choice to a dependable Marriott product with ease this is the place. The layout of the hotel is with the space capsule type elevators which makes us think it was once a Hyatt or something else, but the public areas and gym/club level lounge are all newly remodeled. Rooms, they remain albiet fine, not lavish.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Simplyluvin
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, great location. We were happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, with some Minor Flaws”
Reviews.Author: France N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip in March 2012 for five nights. Great corner room on the 18th floor - huge King bed and well appointed bathroom (which had some issues originally, though quickly addressed by the hotel). Having a corner room is ideal. The Club Lounge on the 21st floor was fairly good for breakfast and for evening snacks - good choices in the AM, not so good in the PM. Also, the alcohol pricing was a bit exorbitant. Parking at the hotel was ridiculously high (including tax: $55/night), but that is the norm for all of San Francisco. Greed, I guess. Great location near plenty of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Ski_n_Tee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a business meeting. The first room we checked into was a weirdly laid out room in the corner of the building that faced Mason St. There was no tub, just a shower, but acres of floor space. Everything was hunky-dorey until 5 am when the trash trucks started picking up outside our window and we never got a wink of sleep after that. The windows are all single pane and so not terribly noise-reducing. Or energy efficient. We asked the front desk to move us and they couldn't have been more helpful or understanding. We moved to the "spa" side of the building (we overlooked the neighboring health club) and were able to sleep. We even got a tub! We never ate at the hotel becuase within a one block area there were lots of diners/restaurants/shops to grab a bite. We did enjoy some drinks at the bar where John took great care of us in the evenings. While my husband slaved away in his business meetings, I went all over town and explored. The hotel is nicely located for shopping at Union Square, Chinatown, or the financial district. You could also hop on a bus tour (discounted tickets are available from the concierge) and see more of the city. I felt safe walking in those areas, but DO NOT GO to the Tenderloin District. The homeless are brazen enough in the Union Square, Chinatown, Financial District, and Fisherman's Wharf, but even the tour busses announce that tourists should not go to the Tenderloin. All in all I would recommend this hotel because it was clean, roomy, moderately priced, and ideally located. Just don't stay on the Mason Street side unless you hate sleeping after 5am.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in a long time”
Reviews.Author: SLVPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a brief visit to SF with my husband. Our trip also included the nearby Ritz-Carlton and the JW was superior in every way. The concierge was incredible helpful - excellent dinner recommendations, moving a car rental to a nearby location et c. The complimentary breakfast for Marriott rewards members was lovely. Right down to excellent espresso. An inicredibly welcoming staff and the room was lovely. The location is great - walking distance/cable car access to the Warf, Chinatown, Union Square. They truly seemed happy to improve your stay. If ever in SF again, I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: DMR
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott is a wonderful choice if you are looking for spacious rooms,comfortable beds and close location to Union Square. The bathroom was large with marble counters and shower. The staff provides excellent customer service. Shopping and restaurants just steps away. Very nice Lobby and bar area. Overnight parking is a steep price, but that goes with staying in down town SF. The only complaint I can make it that you must be warned about the noise, which is no fault of the hotel. Both mornings on Saturday and Sunday at exactly 7:00 am we were awakened by street demonstrators in Union Square who were chanting loudly into bullhorns!!! This went on for almost one full hour each morning. Not sure if this is a common thing or just our bad luck but we had no quiet mornings to sleep in during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, cramped shower”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: This is a luxury hotel and it provides all that you expect. Exemplary service, beautiful accommodations, expensive meals/wifi/mini bar prices, and a very comfortable night's rest in a luxurious bed. My only real complaint is with very small shower stall - I'm 5'9", 170 and I was very very cramped. I can't imagine how larger people could ever take a shower in it. I'm not sure if it was my room or all the rooms are like that. Overall I'd recommend the hotel though, great location in the heart of union square not far from Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “the best stay in san fran!”
Reviews.Author: indotraveller_10
Reviews.Content: Top of the line amongst the Marriott chain of hotels, the JW Marriott is located right in the heart of Union Square. Let me begin my saying that our family's most recent trip to San Francisco was made very enjoyable because of the service from the staff and comfort of the room. Our first surprise was the free upgraded room with a KingSize, plus sofabed room for us and our two little infants. Centrally located to the shopping in Union Square, walking distance to Chinatown, Ferry Market building and cable car lines. For car rentals, the Hertz rep was conveniently located right at the hotel concierge and was very helpful. We were pleased that they provided us with a brand new car, and included a GPS free, which we were able to pick up right at the hotel. The car drop off was conveniently located 1/2 a block away. After a long day of sightseeing, we looked forward to enjoying the free water infused with different variety of fruits daily. The lobby was very spacious with lots of comfortable seating. Room was bright, nicely decorated with a large bathroom. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful, including the reception, housekeeping, concierge and doormen. Some small inconveniences, we were not allowed to store our babies food in the fridge without being charged. They do provide the option of bringing up a fridge for us, but we didn't bother. Also, you could occasionally hear the elevators. Overall, would highly recommend this hotel and definitely looking forward to coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lycheesatsuma
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one-bedroom suite. Beautiful, clean room! Good central location, far enough away from hustle & bustle. Service is wonderful; staff is incredibly accommodating. If you're travelling with a group, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but improve the WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Scottaly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location: loved the large and well decorated rooms, friendly service (especially the concierge guys) and the fitness center. One tip: I was sleeping on the 12th floor and slept like a baby but a colleague sleeping on 7 complained of noise all night long. Only drawback is the WiFi: not great quality and expensive: in this day and age a good business hotel should make an effort to give good quality WiFi for free to its guests, especially when you charge as much as the Marriott does... if most Best Western can give free WiFi it is really hard to accept that a hotel of this level still charges for bad connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Higher floors are much quieter”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravellers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few weeks back and was in a room on the 9th floor. There was a lot of street noise that was audible throughout the day and night. This week, I stayed here again and asked for a higher floor. I was put on the 17th floor and it was much quieter, plus the view was considerably better. The rooms were the same. The showers are quite small and it is not possible to get put the spray while you are lathering up. Also, the tv in my room had signal issues on several high def channels.

Reviews.Title: “Inexcusable problems”
Reviews.Author: Ramatash
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a short 2 night stay. The rooms are decent. The location is OK - it's close to Union Square but it's on the border of the Tenderloin, so be careful not to go the wrong direction. But I had 3 problems that flat out should not have happened at a JW Marriott. 1. I walked into my room and the temperature was at 78 degrees. The AC wasn't working. I told them, came back later and it was fixed. 2. My TV wasn't working. I called, they came up and fixed it. 3. My shower was scalding hot. I called, them came up and fixed a valve and it worked. For a short 2 day stay, you shouldn't have a 3 very basic things go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong here.”
Reviews.Author: MMRDAR5
Reviews.Content: Great location, above average rooms, great service. Hotel in great condition. If you are loyal to the Marriott brand. This is a good choice in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with even a better staff”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: The JW marriott Union Square is my new favorite in San Francisco. If provides a good location & spectacular views ( upper floors) but is still small enough to have great service. Rooms are spacious ( for downtown SF) with seperate tub/shower along with a entry area and a workspace. The concierge lounge was very large with wonderful views of the city/bay in addition above average food.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to walk from. Rooms are nice, spacious and comfortable. Wish they had electrical outlets closer to the bed....don't know why more hotels don't as that is a big help for those of us dependant on our i-things! Really spacious bathroom with tub and shower which I appreciate as I love baths! Concierge lounge was open on the weekend which is another really nice perk-- to often they are only Monday-Friday. Somewhat lengthy wait for check in, lobby is combined with bar area which makes it noisy if you are relaxing -0r trying to- with a glass of wine and friends. No robes in room:(-- that's one thing I love so I miss when it's not there. Parking is really expensive even for San Francisco, but there are several parking garages very close that offer better rates. There is a nice deck area on the 21st floor which is a great spot to enjoy if the weather permits.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Retailer
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets or exceeds the standards for friendliness. Every individual whether it was the knowledgeable concierge, housekeeping, bell staff or bar staff was happy, friendly and had a smile on their faces. The rooms were clean, in good repair and up to date, with 40" TVs and Bose radios. The bathrooms were a good size fitted and in granite. The bedding was comfortable and of high quality. The sound proofing was excellent. Check in and check out was a breeze. Good location 2 blocks off Union Square. We will be back to this hotel on our next trip to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Another great JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: mike89t
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at many JW marriott properties and we are both Gold Elite members. We totally loved this property! The only negative I can think of was the $55 per night for parking. Although in the city that is kind of to be expected. The lobby was beautiful and had a huge atrium with 4 glass elevators. We got upgraded to a city view room on the 15th floor. The room was gorgeous and the bathroom was just fantastic. Everything was high end and well maintained. The service was top notch. There was a free breakfast for Marriot Gold and Platnium Elite members on the 21st floor. They had a fantastic automatic coffee machine and I had my Mocha every morning while my wife had her Latte. The had a good selection of food and drinks as well. I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in the union square area.

Reviews.Title: “Just Like a Homing Pigeon....”
Reviews.Author: HeatherSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This must be my 6th stay here & it is one of the properties I always look to book first when in San Francisco. I have not one bad thing to say about our weekend stay here. We were a family of four, with two teens in their own room. This time we were placed on the 15th floor, which I usually avoid due to height issues. The higher level gave us a substantially lower amount of street noise & a view over many rooftops. The bell desk seems to have become permanently good, as we were greeted & had doors opened every time we exited - not always so on prior visits. The concierge was helpful & friendly helping me solve a gadget glitch - thank you! Our housekeeper was a little over zealous in attempting to clean our rooms both Saturday & Sunday. However, I much prefer the rooms to be done early rather than not have them cleaned by afternoon. She was very sweet, bowing repeatedly to us when we asked her to return in 45 minutes. The rooms were both lovely. I particularly like these bathrooms as they are large, well lit & filled with a pinky brown marble. The breakfast staff was attentive & courteous & I found the coffee to be especially good - and I am not a drip coffee person! This ideal location & pleasant accommodation will definitely be seeing me back in the next few months!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best J W's!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2Astor
Reviews.Content: San Francisco's JW Marriott is first class! From the reservation process, to the comfortable room and concierge room, all were excellent! Illona was an especially friendly and helpful concierge person.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: mmoc65
Reviews.Content: This is a really pretty hotel in a great location. Beds and pillows were not that great, bed could be classified as so hard it was uncomfortable. Really had very little interaction with the staff. Elevators gave me motion sickness.

Reviews.Title: “Fun work stay”
Reviews.Author: 3Jenni
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for a business class. The catering was great, room service very friendly, enjoyed the club lounge. The valet guys are so much fun! Great recommendations on where to walk around town too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is only a couple of blocks from Union Square. That makes it convenient to a number of great restaurants, shopping, etc., but a fair distance from the tourist areas around Fishermans Wharf etc. The set up was nice for business travelers, with a decent work space and good internet access. The club level lounge was large, had great views of the city, and featured a hot breakfast and the usual snacks etc in the evening. The room was large especially by SF standards, and the bathroom was particularly well appointed. The room looked like it had recently been renovated but I am not sure. Overall a nice choice, but not heads and shoulders better than the many other competitors in its price tier (i.e., it is about the same as the SF Hyatt Regency on Market Street, but the SF Ritz Carlton is lightyears better).

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay for business in SF”
Reviews.Author: la_jazz_girl
Reviews.Content: I fly up to San Francisco frequently for business and have my choice of hotels. I've tried every major brand, all of the "famous" old hotels, and some small boutique spots as well over the past 15+ years, but the JW Marriott is my favorite. A quick cab ride to the courthouses and any other business you have to do in the city. The rooms are well appointed and have a modern decor (but not "too hip" like the "W") -- all up to the standards that you've come to expect from this brand. The desk is large, has plenty of outlets, and the internet/wifi never fails me. There's hardly a "lobby" to speak of, but I actually prefer that if I'm in town for business. I always order a full breakfast via room service and I've yet to be disappointed with the quality of the food or the prompt service. When you're done with work, you can stretch your legs and walk around to see the sights, check out the restaurants, and shop. There is an amazing Italian restaurant a few blocks away that I go to each time for linguine w/clams -- of course I can't remember the name, but the concierge can tell you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: LatinaGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few minutes walking distance to the famous Union Square, where you can jump a trolley & head to the famous Fisherman's Wharf. There is plenty of shopping venues and great restaurants as well. The staff is top notch (I reckon they have to be due to the location). The conference rooms are above average.

Reviews.Title: “away from tourist congested hotels!”
Reviews.Author: bento2744
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at JW Marriott in San Francisco. I read reviews of this hotel, as I usually do on Tripadvisor and had some concerns about noise level, but decided to try. This hotel was former Pan Pacific at the corner of Post and Mason, there is another Marriott on Sutter, a block away. I always request high floor and stayed on 18th with city view. The lobby on the third floor and the property has gone through renovation and it is well done. Reviews on Tripadvisor complained about small bathrooms, but all marble bathroom was sufficient in all respect, bed was comfortable and noise problem was not an issue. I think I heard a siren once during my stay and as far as hearing people on the street below, never had any problem. They do charge $49 plus tax for parking, but unfortunately that is the going rate parking in San Francisco with in and out privilege. You can park in Union Square parking for $34 per night, but no in and out, so if you want to stay in the city, you will have to endure the cost. San Francisco has a wonderful transportation system, so if you are staying in city center, take the Bart to Powell Street station and use public transportation to avoid expensive parking fee. I did not dine at the hotel, but with so many places near by, no need to pay expensive hotel prices for mediocre food. I stopped at St Francis Hotel Lobby for 2 glasses of wine and one plate of appetizer and the tab plus tip was $54!!! There is no views, just mob of tourists roaming around the hotel to look see, none guest type. My suggestion for a cocktail is top of the Hyatt in Union Square with a commanding view of the city is much nicer, especially for sunset and it's cheaper. One other experience to share; I originally booked for two nights and when I decided to extend by one additional night, I was told the hotel was booked and they can accommodate me for $279 rate. I sat down with my Laptop and searched for the same hotel and to my surprise, I was able to confirm $ 169 senior rate for the same day? The moral of this experience is don't take no for an answer! The location can not be beat half a block to Powell street cable cars.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing: so many extra charges, nothing is for free”
Reviews.Author: tamca
Reviews.Content: Terribly disappointed in this hotel. I have stayed at a lot of Marriotts all over the world and this is the worst experience with the chain. The only king size bed room they had for us was in a handicap room which was set up really weird so that threw us off. I had booked my room months in advance so they must have given our regular room to someone else. Then they charge for every little thing: Parking is over $50/night (close to 60 with tax), internet in the room is $14/night, yet the convention rate for this hotel is well over $200/night. They have wifi set up, they should be offering it free in the room. C'mon! And it runs noon to noon, so if you sign up in the early morning you don't even get a full 24 hours for your $14! Same with parking. It isn't 24hrs from when you park, but from 5:00. I expect a bit more from Marriott, especially a J.W. Marriott. The rooms aren't spectacular and even up on the 14th floor I could hear street noise. Even in the business center they charge you by the minute. I stayed across the street last time at the Donatello for about $100 less a night and got free internet and a lounge with hot drinks and a nice view. They do have a good work out room. The fireplace in the lobby area is nice. You can find better hotels with more amenities in San Francisco for this price and cheaper. This is a huge rip off and I would never stay here again. Sorry Marriott, I was a fan but you should have been a bit nicer. At least offer coffee in the morning! Sheesh.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but incredidbly noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: HantsJonny
Reviews.Content: I spent the best part of week at this hotel and have stayed here numerous times. Hotel is clean throughout Rooms are good and the beds/linen are really comfortable. I used the gym quite a lot, which is a bit basic and small - but does the job It is noisy though. There always seems to be digging or incredibly loud banging outside between 3am and 5am most mornings This may be just being in San Fran though Bar is good. Food isnt that inspiring but there are so many restaurants about...

Reviews.Title: “Variable ...”
Reviews.Author: The_bald_gourmet
Reviews.Content: First the good news; The location of the JW Marriott is excellent. Close to Union Square, with lots of good restaurants nearby, shops galore and easy access to transportation. The rooms are a very good size, well appointed, clean and well maintained. The bathroom was quite large and the bed was as always, very comfortable. The service from front of house through room service to housekeeping was polite and efficient. So far, so good! Then there is the variability. Breakfast; over the four days I was there, the breakfast never arrived with what I had ordered. Coffee was missing, no hot milk, no silverware, no juice but juice turned up when I hadnâ€™t ordered it! Oh and newspaper two days out of four! TV; HD channels worked great ... everything else looked like a dust storm had blown across the screen making everything pretty much invisible. Elevators; there was one particular â€œrogue elevatorâ€� whose work ethic appeared questionable. It was in and out of service or would just sit on the ground floor and hum gently to itself as its passengers stood inside waiting for it to get off the ground. Add to that the fact that the wait time for an elevator was about the same as a London bus on a wet Friday afternoon! Internet; sometimes fast and instant connection. Two days unable to connect! The explanation (I think) for the variability was due to the fact that there was a major conference taking place at the St. Regis and the JW Marriott just seemed to get overwhelmed. So, not bad, just oddly off key!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay over the holidays”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyGuy
Reviews.Content: Took three rooms, two of them connectors, with the family, cousins and relatives. This property, formerly the Pan Pacific, has a vertigo-inducing interior atrium and glass elevators that the kids like looking into and riding up and down. No work out club, but they will arrange temporary privileges at the Club 1 work out club up Mason St (100 feet from door). Valet parking is expensive; $49-59 depending on size of vehicle. Seriously consider not having a car for your stay. If that isn't in the cards, consider parking itself yourself in the multi-level (and tiny) garage at Mason and O'Farrell. It's more like $33 a day and offers hotel guests in and out privileges, though not sure how. Lobby bar/cafe is nice but expensive. I have honestly say the Level 3 surprised me with much better food (seared fish; salad; nice white wine) that any of us expected. Room service was pretty fast (25 minutes) in the mornings; rooms themselves were large and well cleaned. Beds were comfortable. Water pressure in bathrooms dismal; no real noise in our rooms (1708-1709 and 1721-1722) from the adjacent rooms; however, windows are NOT double paned and you could hear some street noise (didn't keep anyone up or wake anyone). Nice black out drapes. We'd used the property again and enjoyed its central location. Could recommend, for travels, Dottie's True Blue Cafe for one of the very, very best breakfasts in San Francisco (they are going to move in the near future to a rather sketchy location, but for now, it's on Jones); if all you want is tourist food, try Lori's Diner at Sutter and Powell or Sear's Fine foods for Pancakes. Both owned by, I think, Vietnamese guy who has a done a great job with straightforward tourist class food.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: NorcalWanderlust
Reviews.Content: As has been our tradition, my wife and two daughters rent two rooms for two nights before Christmas at the JW Marriott for shopping at nearby Union Square and Holiday evening entertainment. This hotel has become our favorite at Union Squre because it is away from the crowds and frenzy and the rooms, public areas and restaurant have been recently renovated and are maintained in excellent condition. We also believe the hotel is superior to other hotels in the vicinity. The staff is very professional and accommodating. When the concierge was unavailable, the front desk took the initiative to make dinner reservations for us with preferred treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip to Union Square Ever!”
Reviews.Author: PathosGuy
Reviews.Content: I love visiting San Francisco during the Holidays... the Union Square area is decked out in holiday trim, the shopping is fantastic, and the restaurants in the City are incredible. This time, rather than stay up on Nob Hill and trek back/forth (really up/down) with shopping packages, we decided to stay on "flat ground" at the JW... What an incredible choice! Everyone at the hotel was fantastic... the concierge called ahead to welcome us and request ways in which we could enjoy our visit, the front desk welcomed us upon our late arrival, the lounge had an incredible breakfast/afternoon snack selection, and on and on. The staff simply couldn't have been more accommodating! If you're considering a trip to the City for shopping, eating, etc... this should be your headquarters.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pomonan
Reviews.Content: After splurging on a club level suite at the Ritz-Carlton on our previous visit to San Francisco, I was not expecting quite the same experience at the JW Marriott, but was very disappointed by what we got. As previous reviewers have noted, it is challenging to know what makes this worthy of being a "JW". It certainly is not in the same league as previous JW properties we have stayed in (Grosvenor House, London; Ihilani on Oahu, the new JW Marquis in Miami). In fact we have stayed in significantly better "ordinary" Marriotts. Service was moderate, and while the "studio" room was reasonably clean it was a bizarre shape, not well furnished and with an uninspiring view up Post Street. Concierge Lounge was just OK. Fortunately we had taken a last minute decision to cut a five day stay to two days and decamp to Vegas - a wise move based on the standard of this hotel. We are still struggling to find the "ideal" spot in SF, after six attempts. Ritz-Carlton was best, and even at the prices charged probably represents better value than this tired effort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: t25624
Reviews.Content: Our family piled in to this hotel (two rooms) on 12/24. The staff was VERY pleasant and helpful. The concierge had good suggestions of things to do during the holiday. The rooms were well appointed and what I'd expect from a Marriott property. The location is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Quite Live Up to the "JW" Standard”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelPair
Reviews.Content: Quite frankly, we expected more from a JW Marriott property. Between the two of us, we've racked up in excess of over 1 million Marriott points over the past ten years and this was the most disappointing 'flagship' property we've ever stayed at. The 'service first' attitude was generally absent during our 5 day stay. We had a (very clean) corner room on a high floor, but the layout was awkward and the room seemed cramped...especially for an "upgrade". Check-in left a lot to be desired with a very long line and too little help behind the reception counter. All of the unoccupied tables in the concierge lounge were filthy both times we visited. The location is fantastic, with a very easy walk to Union Square and surrounding points of interest. We really enjoyed the enthusiastic staff at the Lobby Bar where we met friends either before or after dinner each night of our stay. We ordered room service twice and the food was very mediocre and our tray was left uncollected in the hallway for several hours after our call to have it picked up. The final nail in the coffin was the goat-rodeo of confusion to pick-up our Hertz rental (the hotel advertises having a Hertz rental location as part of the hotel, which is actually three blocks away and a real challenge to navigate in a parking deck and then to find the way back in the rental car to the hotel through all the one-way streets to load luggage). We wanted to love it...but it left us very blah.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: boydpc
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights. I would gladly stay again. The location, room and service were outstanding. I would recommend getting access to the concierge level as breakfast and evening food service was excellant and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but fair warning”
Reviews.Author: LaneTrane
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Daughter, and I stayed here on 12/30/11, the night before New Year's Eve. The JW is a very nice hotel. Our room was well decorated, very clean, and kinda cool. The bathroom was nice too....big vanity, separate tub and shower, and clean. The shower stall was tiny so if you find an airplane seat a challenge, you'll never fit in the shower. The staff was incredibly nice, polite, and helpful. When you stay at the JW, you live by the sword and die by the sword. When you're close to the action your close to the chaos. The good stuff...you're near all the shopping in Union Square and on Market St, dozens of restaurants, The Warfield, and Nob Hill. The bad stuff....you're close to all that too. Sirens, horns, people spilling out of the bars, etc. We were on the 18th floor (there are only 20) but we could hear EVERYTHING going on outside. Be hard asleep before midnight or plan on nodding off at 2:30am once the streets clam down. Until the JW pumps a couple million into a complete window renovation, it'll remain a 4 star. Would I stay here again?....definitely. A romantic getaway? Definitely not. Fun with the family or with some late-night friends...absolutely. One wish...upgrade the mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience - Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: des104joy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice now. Both experience were very good. The rooms are very nice, the staff is friendly and accommodating, at the location is excellent. 1 short block from Union Square and easy walking distance to the Moscone Center. I will stay here again. This place is comparable to the Marriott Marquis in New York City. The hotel is quiet and had everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not quite a 4 star standard”
Reviews.Author: backpackerPNW
Reviews.Content: It really is a 3-star hotel. And needs some work to be called "JW Marriott". Bed is comfortable, carpet needs replaced. Shower is a bit small. Unlike most JW Marriott timeshare, this hotel does not provide laundry facility for guests use. Decoration is just average similar to the Embassy Suite chain. The property is couple of blocks to Union Square. While we sort of okay with our 4 nights staying during Christmas time, but we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly elegant”
Reviews.Author: masoncho
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night at the JW Marriott Union Square. For Christmas shopping in San Francisco, I would recommend this hotel highly. The service and facility is equal to the JW brand around the world. I would recommend to get a room with executive lounge access, compare to the Hyatt Union Square, it's about 5 time bigger space and you are waiting for seats. The breakfast at the lounge was very good with plenty of choices for a full breakfast buffet. During the day and at evening, lounge is open,and there are plenty of drinks and water bottle. I like to location because it's 1 block from union square,and is surprisingly quiet for downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautuiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jenbzthings
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The location was unbeatable. Walking distance to China Town and all the great shopping that San Francisco has to offer. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite that had great views of the city. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. Parking was expensive, so take a taxi if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Parking was Outrageous! $48.00 per night”
Reviews.Author: fashiongirlnyc
Reviews.Content: Although I slept just fine in my hotel room...I was shocked that the parking is $48.00 a night-FYI.

Reviews.Title: “It's JW Marriott... - no surprises!”
Reviews.Author: tooreck
Reviews.Content: Our California family trip had to go via San Francisco and we ended up at JW Union Square. I've stayed at couple JW's before, but this one is of fantastic quality, I must say. It is very expensive (even as Marriott rewards, it's level 7, the highest) and if it wasn't for tons of points I accumulated before, I'd not pay hundreds of dollars per night. However, since points paid, we enjoyed it. Service was almost instant and everything we (and 3 kids) wanted to was provided with the smile and courteousness. As with most SF hotels, no swimming pool is there so you've got to live with it. Breakfast (in the lounge) was excellent also and, of course, you can't beat the location. Room are well noise-insulated and sleep quality was very good, except perhaps sofa-bed, which was just a standard springy one (and which dad had to take it, obviously ;-<...).

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous experience!”
Reviews.Author: Blake C
Reviews.Content: After first being granted keys to a 3rd floor room that reeked of mold, tucked at the end of a hallway, we were given keys to an 8th floor room. This was only after my girlfriend and I went to the front desk where our ages (we're 23 and 21) then our clothes (we had driven 6 hours from Los Angeles and were still in our sweats) were the subject of a snide smirk. Throughout our stay that night, we were looked down on because of these things. We asked for more towels and got 1; we asked for a blanket and were given the dustiest, rattiest wool blanket that appeared to have been dug up from the basement; when asked for a wake up call we were disconnected. We ended up checking out early the following day and moving across the street to The Donatello where our business was greatly appreciated. My parents have been Platinum level members of Marriott since I was 13 years old. I've never been treated so horribly at any hotel and will surely NEVER be back at this "hotel"!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property and stay”
Reviews.Author: JSAATY
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 12/5 to 12/8. I honestly have no idea what the other reviewers who fail to give this property 5 stars are thinking. This is one of the nicest city-based hotels I've ever stayed at. The interior is highly unique with glass elevators soaring up 21 stories, and lobby level on 3rd floor to create a very intimate feel. No riff-raff from the streets walking around which in San Francisci can be an issue at other hotels. Stayed in a junior suite for nominally more cost - room 2022 , which ended up being a corner room on top floor of rooms with a view of city and Golden Gate/Marin Headlands. The bar is excellent, plenty of space for casual business meetings on first floor, good restaurant for breakfasts. The room was totally silent, no noise whatsoever. Open the window and you may hear a bit of street noise from far below, but definitely nothing bothersome. Valet parking easy, and the guys out front exceptionally helpful. Location near to Union Square -- 1 block away and like 4 blocks to Chinatown and other fun things makes the location ideal. Definitely will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Quiet but a little depressing”
Reviews.Author: Brad B
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in San Francisco earlier this week. The city is great at Christmas time. Fun to be in the Union Square area with shopping and Christmas everywhere. The JW Marriott was fairly pricey for the experience. If you need a quiet, low key, business hotel then it might be a good choice. But if you are hoping to stay somewhere with at least a slight pulse of energy then this is not for you. The hotel has the high atrium rising to the 21st floor which limits natural light at the lobby level. Feels grey inside all day. Sort of depressing. Service was good and rooms are nice. Location is good as well but I wanted to be out of the hotel the whole stay. SF has too many good options to stay at the JW if you want to have at least a little enjoyment in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “JW Redeemed!”
Reviews.Author: CocoMaKai
Reviews.Content: After a very disappointing stay in their Phoenix location, we were uncertain what we'd find in SF. This location is truly a JW brand. Granted, we were placed on the 20th floor with a City View, so I'm not sure if other levels and views would leave you with the same impression. The 3rd floor lobby is warm and inviting with a fire place, atrium, sitting alcoves, great bar and friendly service. We usually don't get impressed with elevators, but this place has the best. Fast, efficient and plenty for the number of guests. Don't think we ever waited for more than a few seconds for one to arrive. As soon as we entered the room, we knew we had landed someplace special. They have interest with different wall colors and architecture, not your usual "cookie cutter" style room. The view from our rooms were fantastic and extra special at night. I hate being trapped in recirculated air hotels and the windows opened a bit to allow for fresh air....nice! The bathrooms are generous for a city hotel. They also added A LOT of mirrors to make the space seem larger. The only drawback was the size of the shower. We are a thin family and you had to be very creative about how you were going to shave your legs. Like my husband said, when you towel off in the shower you wipe the walls dry at the same time. We had connecting rooms and the place they adjoined was perfect. Usually, they seem to place the connection near the bedroom area, but this hotel had them down the hallway between the closets and bath. It added more privacy, yet still convenient. I can understand the complaints about the street noise, but the hotel is in a prime and busy location. I'm a very light sleeper and I did have to resort to my Ambien stash for a few nights even on the 20th floor, but we were staying there over Thanksgiving and Black Friday. The streets were full of action, people partying, etc. Overall, it did meet and exceed our expectations in most areas. It was deserving of the JW branding as we've seen at their other locations, minus Phoenix. We look forward to returning !

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the fridge!”
Reviews.Author: Pelagius_Redivivus
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious and clean, and the hotel is in a good location, just a block along from Union Square. For the price, however, I would have expected a bit more. Wifi in the bedroom was extra, as was breakfast â€“ although I gather that these extra charges are typical of US hotels more generally. The room service was a bit remiss â€“ waste basket not emptied one morning, and toilet roll not replaced on one occasion. Iâ€™d expect better at a 4-star hotel like this. The waiter at breakfast was extremely vigilant, noting that I had helped myself to two pancakes at the buffet, thus raising the category of the meal from â€˜Goodstartâ€™ to â€˜Fullâ€™, as well as the price! Donâ€™t be tempted to self-cater at breakfast at such a posh place, and on no account overlook the sign on the fridge door, which states that items removed for 15 seconds or more are considered as purchases, and that there is an extra charge for storing oneâ€™s own items!!

Reviews.Title: “Two sleepless nights -- noise from neighboring rooms and street noise (even on 19th floor)”
Reviews.Author: Frankie2213
Reviews.Content: Although the amenaties and location of the hotel are good, the overall experience we had here was unacceptable, due to the fact that we were unable to get a good night of sleep either of the nights we stayed there. VERY thin walls meant we heard everything from the neighboring rooms, intensified by a screaming baby on one side each night. Additionally, even with a room on the 19th floor, consistent noise from the streets below was easily heard in our room, including construction work and organized events moving through the streets. For $700 for a two night stay, I dont see this as up to par at all, and will certainly influence my future plans.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: T.B.Patriot
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel situated perfectly. The room is nice and as the other person said, it's what you expect from a JW brand of Marriott. However, for this type of a hotel, it really should have a bigger health center as it is a small closet here. Also there is no pool or jacuzzi. Overall, I would stay again for a right price as there are many hotels near by that are comparable.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian1667
Reviews.Content: the hotel is well maintained, service was impeccable, friendly helpful staff..everyone treated like a VIP....great bar in the lobby,good work-out room.....rooms are cleaned early in the day etc...first time I can recall getting into my room at noon instead of 'arrival time' at 4pm...nice treat....rooms are first rate too. Only negative is that there is no pool

Reviews.Title: “Nice but that is expected”
Reviews.Author: sandinmyshoes2
Reviews.Content: Nice property in a good location. Just a short walk to mass transit or Chinatown. Being a Marriott I had high expectations and this hotel was about what I had expected

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AA75
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, right next to the Union Square and all the shopping, China town, short cab ride to Fisherman Wharf or Golden Gate. The rooms are small but full of amenities. High floor rooms have amazing views of SF and concierge level offered a big variety of snacks for breakfast and dinner. There are plenty of restaurants and bars around the hotel, one of the employees recommended Gold Dust lounge just a couple of blocks from the hotel, we were not impressed. We found another bar inside the Westin Hotel, called Clock Bar, which was a higher end lounge and lots of fun! Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, okay location for tourists”
Reviews.Author: TravlinTXFamily
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with large rooms and large bathrooms. We had a corner executive king with a partial view of the Golden Gate Bridge. We took a cab from the airport that was around $50. We stayed two nights. The first night I heard a lot of street noise but I don't live in the city so I don't know how that affects others. We were on the 20th floor. Breakfast in the concierge lounge was okay but the coffee machine (espresso, latte, etc.) was wonderful. The appetizers in the evening were not hot (cold beef skewers? ick). There was a nice cheese plate though. $7 for wine and around $9 for cocktails. Lots of water and granola bars. Parking is $50 per night so we took a cab from the airport as I mentioned and then rented from the Avis down the street (675 Post St) at the end of our stay. There is a Hertz in the hotel but it was significantly more expensive. The concierge gave us great recommendations for dining and directions to various attractions. Although I liked the hotel I would consider staying at the Marriott Fishermans Warf next time just because of the location. We were sightseeing and spent a lot of time getting to where we needed to be. On the upside we were able to ride the cable cars quite a distance which was a fun experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: cjg2901
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but make sure you get a high floor. You will hear trash trucks early in the morning. The bellman just brought my bags in and set them down. He didn't help put them on racks or show me the room amenities. I found the nice coffee service in a box inside of a bathroom cabinet. The coffee pot is inside a bathroom cabinet too. Beware, valet parking is very expensive at least $50 night. So a cab might be cheaper. Overall nice hotel but just needs a little better service

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: lighthouse_lover_111
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location, great views from the 21st floor and a nice atrium runing from the 3rd to the 21st floor with glass elevators. It is a ten minute walk to the Bart station to get to the SF Airport. I was there attending a conference and the food and refreshment service was excellent. Wireless in the common areas was good and the technology room amenities were above average.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bariatricrunner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights. Our first time. Good location in Downown San Francisco. Building is a bit old. Has a nice size club lounge on the highest floor, the 21st with great views and good food. The rooms are large, comfortable and clean. The fitness center is small. No pool or spa here. Very close to car rental companies, within one or two blocks and 4 blocks from China Town. Good place for business or pleasure stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Location - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparkyG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of August, we were upgraded to a corner suite which was a great size. The bathroom was huge. The staff were friendly and the location is really great. I have no complaints and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atraveler910
Reviews.Content: Great value, great location. The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean and very nice. Has a separate tub and shower. The front desk was very friendly and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco High Class”
Reviews.Author: aarbter
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the JW Marriott San Francisco at Union Square. The hotel service was adequate to it's standard. The overall hotel appearance as well. Meeting premises are available and comfortable, however the carpets pattern seemed a bit out of a different time way ago. The Level III restaurant provides good food and drinks at a reasonable price (no low budget though). The room was of comfortable size and clean. The bathroom though was like stuck in the 80ies, brown marble and a rather strange arrangement of setup, however just fine. The bed was comfortable and provided a good rest - if there were not these thin walls... Unfortunately I was witness to a couple argument of the room next door, as it started to escalate I tried to inform the Reception/Concierge - but only got as far as to an answering machine. Luckily the couple separated before I was able to leave my room to get security. Putting this once incident aside, the hotel stands out to be very well located and easily be reached by BART transport from the airport. In walking distance to Market street and all its shops, also is Chinatown (if one likes to walk a bit further) or very close Union Square. All in all the JW Marriott provides a travler a comfortable stay, however the deco is a bit neglected.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: calitravelbug
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel. Great location and fantastic service! Hotel bars (lobby and top floor) are wonderful. Small but nice gym open at convenient times. Great for couples and family trips.

Reviews.Title: “First-rate service at the JW”
Reviews.Author: TeeEmm
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at the JW Marriot. This hotel is deceptive in a way, because the lobby is on the 3rd floor, so the hotel doesn't seem very impressive at first it's also hard to spot when driving past. However, once inside and up on the lobby level it's lovely. The room was over-sized, the beds very comfy, and the bathroom was big and luxurious. I think the thing that made this stay so good was the staff. The check-in was very quick and friendly, the bar staff were very, very nice. The restaurant staff were so sweet to my five-year old daughter. She ordered mac & cheese, and frankly it was too good for kids! Absolutely gourmet kid food. The guys on the valet service also arranged for us to use the hotel's town car to take us to a restaurant (without any charge). I don't know if this was the norm. but it was a very nice touch. We normally stay the Hilton when in San Francisco, but from now on I think we'll go with the JW. The location is great â€“Â easy, quick walk to Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBeau
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Fran on short notice for fun, and realised no one should ever do this because finding a Hotel was a bit of a challenge. After a few calls this place had one room left thanks to my fiance's cousin who had called and told me to call them back to make a reservation and not to take no for an answer because he knew there had been a cancelation. After calling and asking for the front desk because reservations saw it as being booked. They tried to also tell me there was nothing, but after hard work and them talking to there manager I got them to fess up and hold the room for me. THe hotel staff was very accomidating when we arrived even got us a crib. Held our stuff the next day while we shopped around. We have never stayed in the City so we were surprised of the hotel prices, but as I learned this is to be expected of San Fran you pay for everything. We were dissapointed to pay $12.45 ish for internet for one day, most places you stay this is free but not here and maybe not at any hotel in san fran. All in all this place is very nice and we would stay here again, if we were rich:)

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sheridangreen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times when my wife ran in the Nike Women's Marathon. The property was very nice and felt new, even though it has been there for a while. The room is quiet compared to the noise on the street (we opened and closed the windows several times, and the difference was amazing. The beds were comfortable as usual; we always want to stay at Marriotts because the beds are so consistently great. The staff was friendly and helpful, and certainly catered to the 'running crowd' for the marathon (they offered to bring up a tub of ice for my wife's feet after the race; we declined, but got some ice for our drinks!). The location is excellent, which probably accounts for some of the expense. Since it is right next to Union Square, there are a lot of key shopping and dining locations nearby. I cannot comment on the food at this hotel, since we always choose to eat at one of the many great diners or restaurants nearby. All in all, I would consider this hotel to be a spacious, clean, quiet island in the sea of noise and humanity of SF's downtown, and found the additional cost to be worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: vacagirl79
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. The room was clean and the location couldn't be beat. The people were very nice, front desk staff was quick and efficient and the concierge made a great recommendation for a tour. Breakfast was quick and tasty!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JETLAG01
Reviews.Content: Great hotel off the square. Good creature comforts and close to the shopping area. Only two gripes.......... 1st gripe: the price you pay for breakfast and available selection is VERY disappointing. Rather go out the hotel to many of the diners and get better value. 2nd gripe: no free internet in the room (why is it that some hotels offer free internet in the lobby but not in the room?

Reviews.Title: “Predictably High Standards”
Reviews.Author: RiversideAbroad
Reviews.Content: The joy of staying at a JW Marriott flows from the high standards of service, comfort and cleanliness and the absence of surprises. Although far more affordable than the super luxury brands in town, the property provides a no-surprise pleasant experience. For leisure travelers, what's missing is the charm that more unique, less rigorously branded properties offer. Good value, high level of comfort and service(soft terry robes, abundant towels, great stall shower) , great location near Union Square, very good fitness center (also near great restaurants shopping and for business travelers reasonably close to the financial district), but if you're looking for a memorable or uniquely SF experience, try elsewhere. Like all SF hotels, the noise at 5 in the morning from the garbage trucks manages to make it up to even the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “High Price, High Quality”
Reviews.Author: mwill210
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this Marriott. The room had a great view and was nicely decorated. Breakfast was included - a buffet with plenty of healthy selections. This hotel is close to BART, very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at the best location. But misses some details.”
Reviews.Author: GUSDALI
Reviews.Content: Expensive hotel, but worth it just for the location. The room is sapacious but sounds impersonal as all the rest of the hotel. We think that with the high price you pay, the JW could offer more and better services, such as swimming pool, sauna (only has a small fitness room), and free internet as well (I still think a discourtesy, the policy of Marriot to charge so expensive for net access). Other good points are the fast and efficient check in/out and the good concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Jestferlaffs1963
Reviews.Content: I really have nothing bad to say about the hotel, it is a beautiful Hotel with a great lobby and really good elevator setup, lots of fun for the kids I would assume. Prior to our arrival I had pre ordered a bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries and they were not in the room when we arrived, I did mention this to the front desk prior to us going out for dinner that evening and when we came back the champagne and strawberries were there, but the wow factor was diminished. Too bad. That would be my only real concern everything else was just fine, no real issues. Matthew

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: ms.go-go
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice once for business and once for a family trip. Both times I thought this was a great hotel . You can walk very easily from here to just about anywhere and it is so near to the cable cars . There are nice bars and restaurants near. We asked the doormen where they went for breakfast and lunch and got good tips. Good food and great prices . My husband and I went to a dualing piano bar a few blocks away and had the very best fun night. Safe area. Staff is helpful front desk was not the friendliest but everyone else was. it was a good place to have a short stay. I enjoyed this hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Super Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: LindaM57
Reviews.Content: The JW is a wonderful luxury hotel without being pretentious. All of the staff members were friendly, courteous, and very helpful. The rooms are contemporary and very clean with large marble bathrooms (plush towels and nice bathroom amenities too!). The bed (with luxury bedding) was SO comfortable that we slept late every morning! We had access to the concierge level which was on the top floor of the hotel and they provided excellent complimentary amenities in a big, comfortable lounge setting -- hot breakfast buffet and cocktails and hors d'oevres between 5-7pm. Soft drinks, water and coffee were available all day, as were multiple TVs and computers. The hotel is in a great location just a short block from Union Square. This is the second time I have stayed at the JW with my husband and 10 year old, and we would definitely stay there again next time we are in San Francisco. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nicely located hotel, excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: docNeptun
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at the hotel during my 7-day business trip to San Francisco. My room was huge with a full-height window facing towards the academy of liberal arts. Union square is only one block away. the king sized bed was very comfy. I had no problem with street noise, the room was very quiet. The bathroom obviously was laid out to be wheelchair accessible with a large floor-level shower and special wall-mounted handles. I was no fan of the shower curtain, though. The breakfast buffet was great. The hotel staff was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: scantx
Reviews.Content: I really wasn't going to write a review about this hotel because we are loyal / platinum Marriott members. However, I think if you are looking for that "JW Marriott" experience, you won't find it here. The biggest problem here is street noise. We were on the 18th floor & could hear loud street noise morning, day & night. Staff was not very friendly (bordering rude), bellmen always seemed so confused & it was very hard catching cabs from this hotel. 2 good things: Darlene, the concierge, & location (walking distance to everything). If you are interested in a private wine tour in Napa, talk to Darlene. Good restaurants to try: lunch @ Four Seasons, Yank Sing for Dim Sum, Ozuma for sushi & Boulevard for dinner. Make reservations or you will be waiting...even during lunch. We will not be staying here again. There is another / newer Marriott up the street on Powell that is a newer property. We'll that a shot next time.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable, conveniently located hotel with very spacious rooms - why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: schira9
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the JW Marriott San Francisco on August 25th. The hotel was beautiful, comfortable, and very conveniently located. I purchased a PURE room for the first time to see what it was all about. I typically suffer from allergies and hotel stays are typically challenging for me. This room made all the difference in the world and I was quite skeptical at first. They are basically hypo-allergenic rooms that have a PURE air filtering system that apparently can work wonders. I slept through the entire night and woke up feeling clear, rested, and very refreshed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It has a very understated luxury about it but was welcoming at the same time - nothing stuffy, just a very high level of service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “A very good surprise”
Reviews.Author: jmfalmeida
Reviews.Content: One of the best room plans I ever seen. Very functional comfortable and pleasant. Excellent service, good views over San Francisco and staff very courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Ok... nice”
Reviews.Author: Miamiusa1
Reviews.Content: It was ok... nice... close to where I needed to do business.... Everyone agree (employees as well) the hotel needs to be redone...... I had good time... so, all good... slept well. Great room service & valet.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel in covenient location”
Reviews.Author: jpmsenior
Reviews.Content: After staying for many years at the Pan Pacific in this location, I was frankly nervous when the property was reflagged as a JW Marriott a few years ago. Despite a couple of noisy stays during the renovation works a few years ago, it remains my favorite hotel in San Francisco -- a good balance of location near Union Square, well designed rooms (a Portman designed hotel with atrium lobby) and lobby, and away from the "dead" financial district on weekends and the less attractive convention centre area. The restaurant is ok, but there are lots of great restaurants nearby. Quite often rates can also represent very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, great service...”
Reviews.Author: MarkW4MW
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly staff and well appointed room... Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Hotel - but if you have car can consider further away from town or the Marriott Hotel just next door”
Reviews.Author: HardBedVeteran
Reviews.Content: The last of our three Marriott properties on this vacation, and as we were first-timers to San Francisco, we decided to stay in the middle of the city for convenience. If you're driving - please note that parking in the city will set you back at least US$24/overnight, and US$55/overnight on-property so do be prepared to accept this. This JW Marriott property is housed in a classic building with internal bubble lifts and the lightwell design where the corridors open up inside makes the property look very big and roomy. The service was very good from the Valet to the Bell services (again to help with the already ridiculous shopping-stuffed luggage bags). Breakfast was not included but there are many diners around the hotel that serve us full meals for an average of US$11/pax! Rooms here are very well appointed and large (for Asian Standards) and features the Marriott Hotel digital entertainment system. I think there was a gym here but am not sure as spent most of our time exploring the city. My only suggestion is that perhaps the shower cubicle (as the shower and bathtubs are separate) also have a flexible hose shower head as not everyone likes the rain shower head fixed above. (and we didn't use the bathtub although it has a flexible shower hose as it didn't have a shower curtain - just might get the whole bathroom all wet...) Check-out was very convenient and straight-forward and overall a very pleasant property. We had an exciting morning the day we checked out: as we were preparing to leave for breakfast, the fire alarm for the hotel sounded and since there was no warning in our rooms about a scheduled test we assumed that there was indeed and emergency so we evacuated the building. Once outside a management rep informed us that it was a false alarm (but the SFFD was already there!)! Good thing we were just on the 8th floor so the walk down was considered an appetite-starter! :) It was very easy to find the fire exit, map located on your room door! If you're looking to be in town for business, or want to explore the city on foot and public transportation, this is the hotel for you. If you have car, can consider many other properties a little further away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, except for noise, wireless access”
Reviews.Author: a_traveler54
Reviews.Content: I really like a lot of things about this hotel: the staff are extremely friendly and helpful; the rooms are well put together and seem quite fresh; the location, just off of union square, is fantastic; and the hotel seems very well run. However, there are two big negatives that lower what would otherwise be a five-star rating: First, the noise. Even on the 11th floor, there was a lot of street noise, and there was a constant low-pitched rumbling much of the time. It made it difficult to sleep. If I were to stay at this hotel again, I'd ask for a room that is not facing the street, if possible. Second, the wireless internet access was, by far, the worst I've experienced in recent years. The wireless connection kept dropping, and even when it worked, it was extremely slow. I think this is unacceptable at a "luxury" hotel, especially in SF, and especially when wifi is not free (except in the lobby). For these reasons, I would pick a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in SF I have stayed in in the last 5 years”
Reviews.Author: Sledge112952
Reviews.Content: The staff at the JW were very personal. They were giving the sevice a hotel gave back in the day. From the Valet to the new greeter in the lobby as you got off the Elevator, You Knew you were going to have a fabulous visit. The Concierge lounge first class with great munchies at happy hour and a real good breakfast in the morning.I think the hotel must have new leadership because I did not get the attention to detail on my last visit. Keep up the great work

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - expensive though”
Reviews.Author: Richard-Ipswich
Reviews.Content: First off: Itâ€™s a real nice hotel. Obviously itâ€™s in a great spot, one block from Union Square. Close enough to be a short walk from everything downtown, but just slightly removed from the max noise of the Square. The room we had was large and very well appointed, looking new and impeccably clean. The bathroom was also large, with a bath and separate shower, all done in tasteful marble. The bed was particularly excellent; just the right level of firmness with loads of squidgy pillows. We slept very well. We had room-service breakfast a couple of mornings and it was about as good as it gets for a US breakfast i.e. the best. It arrived dead on time, brought by a courteous person. There was more than we could eat and it was delicious. We did pop into the bar once for a drink and it was comfortable if rather corporate. Not somewhere anyone would go unless they were staying at the hotel though. There was a restaurant area but it looked little-used and was not even mentioned in the roomâ€™s hotel guide, so I canâ€™t say much about it. The staff were universally friendly and helpful. Always ready with a smile and friendly word. Check-in was quick and efficient. Of course, there were a few niggles. Things that might or might not bother you but as private (rather than corporate) travellers they did take the edge off the stay for us: First off, there were the seemingly unnecessary extra charges. Letâ€™s face it, this place is expensive; you are paying a location premium and itâ€™s a good hotel, so why charge $13 a day for internet access or $55 a day for parking? Both of these can be had for half the price locally so the hotel really doesnâ€™t need to rip off their guests for these services. If your company is paying then this might not bother you but for us it just meant we had to spend a little time finding cheaper wireless internet and parking, time that the hotel could have saved us by not being so mean. That price premium is reflected elsewhere in the hotel - $5 for a couple of strips of bacon, $13 for a glass of chardonnay, $18 for a movie. At a room rate of $269 a night, they really shouldnâ€™t be hiking up the prices like this. Only other niggle, and itâ€™s not so big, is the lobby/reception area. There isnâ€™t one really or at least not on the street front. When you arrive it looks like the entrance to an underground parking lot, with a few chairs for smokers; when we arrived I first thought we were at a service entrance. Once inside itâ€™s just a smallish elevator waiting area up to III, where the lobby proper is. Then itâ€™s very nice. One more small thing: The room was a double, yet had only one chair to sit on to eat our room-service meals. This meant one of us had to perch on the edge of the high bed to eat. This might be a reflection of the hotelâ€™s more usual single business traveller clientele. So, in summary, it was a lovely stay, the room and service were excellent. If you arenâ€™t on any kind of budget and donâ€™t mind the slightly impersonal feel of the building and bar then you should have a good stay too. Oh, almost forgot to say...Make sure you get dropped off at the right hotel! There are at least three Marriotts close by and its all too easy for a taxi driver to take you to the wrong one when you first arrive - as happened to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MSportsAuto
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff. Stayed to be near Union Square. Found it to be great location, to walk to trolley or catch the sightseeing bus. Our room was great very uptodate. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Zero complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: cathyhub
Reviews.Content: Really a wonderful hotel. Fabulous location, good-sized room, friendly staff (esp our maid!), wonderful linens. Small glitch -- I wanted a double double; they only had a king. Answer: no problem, rollaway bed for free. Small glitch: got put right near the elevator. Answer: no problem, as soon as we shut the door we couldn't hear any outside noise including the elevators. Small glitch: you can't take anything out of the fridge for more than 15 seconds. But where am I going to put my yogurt? Answer: no problem, here's a free mini fridge. Love this place! Love the pillows, love the staff, great memories, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: daspurz
Reviews.Content: Nice, trendy hotel in a great location in SF. Service was great and the room was wonderful too. Any additional requests, room service, etc was taken care of in a prompt manner. The room was very comfortable, spacious and came with a great view of San Francisco. The showers are nice too. I would recommend staying here multiple times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: biniland
Reviews.Content: Excellent location but the front desk staff were not great. Probably service in America was generally lacking. My room was big and I loved all those pillows and cusions on the bed. It was extremely comfortable. Great bathroom also. I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: objective12
Reviews.Content: A few steps away from Union square. The concierge and bell-boys were friendly and extremely helpful. We were in a lovely spacious studio on a high floor. My advice would be to either memorise where the lights are when you go to bed at night or keep a flashlight handy:) First night I was there, couldn't find the light switch in the bathroom at 3 am! So frustrating when you are not alone in the room and can't put on the room lights. Surprised they hadn't thought of those switches that glow in the dark. If I had very young children, I would be nervous staying on a high floor. The balcony rails did not look to me to be child-safe. They probably are, if they were allowed but, I have seen young children stick their heads into smaller spaces than the ones they had at the JWM. Worth checking out if you plan on visiting with 2 year olds. Otherwise, a nice place to stay in SF. The room was always cleaned early and was spotless. For smokers, they have a nice set up outdoors in the front of the hotel, with sofas, cushions, and ashtrays. Very civilised:)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Location, but...”
Reviews.Author: ladybugg73
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the location and were not disappointed! We stayed on the 17th floor and the view of the city was fabulous! The room itself was beautifully appointed and the beds (and pillows) were so comfortable. Parking here is $55, but we chose to park in the Union Square parking garage (only 1 1/2 blocks away) for $32. My only complaint was that we were charged $51 for mini bar items that we did not use. I honestly didn't even know there was one! We called customer service and they said the charges will be reversed, we will see. Moral; watch your credit card statement!

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of”
Reviews.Author: pickietravlr
Reviews.Content: We came to this hotel after a bad experience at another. The front desk was very friendly, helpful and offered first cass service. The hotel coffee bar was handy and the restaurant was very good. Overall a very relaxing and pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: J_A_Mc98
Reviews.Content: We were switching hotels so we showed up around noon hoping for an early check in which we received with no problem. The valet staff was very courteous and helpful unloading our car and bringing our bags up. Unfortunately we arrived on Friday afternoon and weren't able to enjoy the concierge lounge which is closed on the weekend. The cable car stop was a few blocks away and received great directions and tips on how to get around the city. I would definitely stay again if returning to SF!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TheCommanderLeyland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night and found it an ideal location for exploring Union Square and local shops. Not cheap, but good value. Car Parking Vala Service $50 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: LLSCJ
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, exemplary service and staff. The spacious bathroom was a pleasant surprise. The location was great. We stayed at the Marriott Marquis as well during this trip and found this one to be a better experience. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ne_quine
Reviews.Content: We selected this Marriott hotel after someone recommended it to us on the TA forums and what a great recommendation it was! Our first impression upon entering the hotel was â€˜wowâ€™ and we seemed to repeat it quite often during out weekâ€™s stay. Check-in was a breeze and the ladies on the front desk were very friendly and efficient. There was a slight problem with the room type allocated but the ladies changed it without hesitation to the one we were after. Indeed, I was really impressed with one of the ladies who actually remembered my name when we stopped by to check something out later on in the week â€“ that has never happened to me before! The lifts in the hotel are very different from any others in that you can watch the floors rise/fall as you go up/down because they are glass lifts. It did take a bit of getting used to! Our room was on the 11th floor overlooking Mason Street. The room was massive! A large bed with a sitting area to the side, a large desk with a comfy chair and the large flat screen TV. And a big plus from other Marriott hotels weâ€™ve stayed at â€“ firm pillows!!! The air con worked very well and you barely heard it working. The bathroom was massive too with a separate shower although it would have been better if the shower head hadnâ€™t been fixed to the wall. I liked the toiletries that were in the bathroom, the moisturiser especially since I didnâ€™t take any with me â€“ and no, you didnâ€™t have to pay for them! As for those who have mentioned noise â€“ yes you heard the odd fire engine pass but it wasnâ€™t loud enough to really cause any major hassles. I canâ€™t say we heard any other noises from either the street or the atrium given the way the hotel is laid out. The concierge lounge was a great place to go for breakfast or somewhere to go in the evening either pre/post evening meal. The ladies were very friendly and helpful especially the one on in the morning. And the view from the lounge earned another â€˜wowâ€™ from us too! We ate at the bar a couple of nights - that mac & cheese was absolutely delicious! The bar staff were very friendly to you as were the restaurant staff the night we ate there, so much so they used to come up and chat to us when we were sitting in the bar having a drink. I wouldnâ€™t say that either the bar or the restaurant was over-priced. The location of the hotel was great â€“ just minutes away from Union Square and the main shopping zone of the city. We took the recommendation of the concierge for a meal in Chinatown and wasnâ€™t disappointed. The bell-boys were super efficient in getting taxiâ€™s when they were needed and were always ready with a warm smile when you returned back to the hotel. Iâ€™d more than recommend this hotel to anyone â€“ itâ€™s the first time weâ€™d stayed at a JW but it probably wonâ€™t be the last if the standards of the JW San Francisco is anything to go by!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SLC-MLBF
Reviews.Content: We check in to the JW Marriott for a 3 night stay with our two teenagers. I had reqeusted a high floor and was put on the 6th floor. The woman that checked us in was pretty cold. The hotel is nice and clean. Great location for seeing the sight in San Francisco. The beds were soft and was great for a good nights sleep. However, with being on the 6th floor, we heard all of the street noices for most of the night. That does not happen in most Marriott hotels. As this was not build as a Marriott in the first place, that may be a factor for the noice as it is an older hotel. The concierge was great and gave us some great tips for seeing the city. Note that parking is 48.00 per night plus tax. That is the going rate for parking this area of San Francisco. At check out the front desk agent informed us that we could have parked our car across the street for a bit less. He was very helpful and wished he would have been on duty when we checked in.
