Reviews.Content: Wonderful clean decor done with impeccable taste. Quiet rooms, no one bothers you, but everyone is available at a moments notice to help you. A complimentary hotel car is available to take guest to restaurants, plays, etc. Parking which is usually $42 a night was included in a recent special rate. Nice add-on.

Reviews.Title: “Service is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After an exhausing two-week tour of northern California, we ended at the Pan Pacific. The attendants wouldn't hear of us touching our luggage, and were happy to return our rental car for us for a $5 charge. The reception desk (on the third floor of all places!) had a big bowl of fresh apples and they made us feel very welcome, and our luggage arrived almost immediately. The zen-like rooms were calming and relaxing. The bathroom, including a TV and phone, was something else---taking a bath became a must! They have a butler button which you push for any need (ice, more bathrobes, maps, pillow service, anything) which they cater to immediately. We had a bunch of stuff to ship and asked where we could find a shipping place--they took it, wrapped it, and shipped it for a nominal charge. We had to check our bags at the end of our trip (taking the red-eye home) and they were ready when we returned to catch the taxi to the airport which they were to call for us--except they gave us the hotel car (much, much nicer) for the taxi price, instead. I've been in service-oriented hotels before, but not like this. It was the perfect way to end our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for an AWESOME Price !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The Pan Pacific is one of the BEST hotels I've stayed at in San Francisco. Booked through Expedia for (I think) $140 a night for a Superior Room. Got at the hotel at about 2pm, and they checked me in early, which is great. Check-in was extremely quick. I also took an upgrade to a Pacific Suite for only $300 for my 4-night stay. I LOVED the suite I was upgraded to. Now about the suite: Opened the door and heard lovely jazz music. Walked in and saw the living room. Very nice TVs and Bose Clock Radios. Also a very nice first bathroom. I then opened up the sliding french doors to the bedroom. Great beds, not too soft and not too hard. Just right! Great desk with egronomic chair. The view was great but I could see some buildings. I woke up one morning to a guy staring straight into my room from across the street. He was pretty far away, so it's okay. Very nice master bathroom with a small but good television in it. Very nice overall! Now about the service: Service was very prompt. Didn't order any room service so I cannot comment on that. Conceriege was great. Asked for recommedations on good steakhouses and recommended the Morton's right down the street. Housekeeping was great too, as well as turndown service. Great doormen, all greeted me by name by the third night. Opened the door for me every time I stepped up to the hotel even if they were talking to someone else. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION: Those three words came to mind when I first came to the hotel. One block from Union Square, 6 blocks from Moscone Center (where my conference was being held), and restaurants right when you step out the door. 10% off Macy's Coupon when you check-in which is great. Starbuck's is only a block away which is EXCELLENT since I practically went there like every two hours. Walgreen's was about two blocks away, which is also EXCELLENT for getting soda, snacks, and other stuff. RESTAURANT: Went to the hotel's restaurant for three mornings in a row for their breakfast buffet. No omelet bar, but hey who needs that? Pretty good for the price. OVERALL: I really recommend this hotel to anyone coming to San Francisco. Great location and prices through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rather than stay at the recommended chain hotel for the large conference I was attending, I chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews & they were right on the mark, once again. I requested & received a quiet room on a high floor - I could see the hills & the Bay in the distance. The room was tasteful, comfortable & clean, and the bed was outstanding. Firm, with a soft topper & soft pillows & a doublesheeted light down comforter. Just perfect. Terry robes, morning paper, pleasant and accommodating staff. Late one evening I had some trouble regulating the AC & I called the front desk. Within 5 minutes, the engineer was there to fix it. It was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: vickam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific. My only advice to any readers of this site is : Stay there! I found this to be an excellent hotel in every respect. Beautiful accommodation and location could not be more convenient. On my next visit to S.F. I will stay there and if this hotel is not available I will change my travelling dates. Excellent - this hotel was a highlight of the holiday

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a very relaxing weekend in the city. I'm a frequent travler to San Fran and have stayed in many hotels all over the city and the Pan Pacific is one of my fav's. It's location is unbeatable - right off Union Square. It is a little less hetic being a block away from Union Square, but still very close, so within seconds you are in the middle of it all. I liked how the lobby was on the third floor; it made it very calm and away from the hustle of Post St. I enjoyed sitting by the fire in the lobby enjoying a drink. Our room was awesome, very large! The bed was wonderful, one of the best hotel beds. The bathroom was also awesome, with a separate shower and tub, all surrounded by black marble. All in all it was a great weekend shopping, relaxing, but the best part by far was the Pan Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a Baby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I bought 3 nights on Hotwire for $108 a night. I could not have afforded it otherwise. This is a four or five star hotel. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a junior suite at no extra charge. The bed had a pillow top and was marvelous. I slept like a baby. Our room had a flat screen tv and also a tv in the bathroom. The bathroom had a tub and a glass shower. The concierge was great, very knowledgeable and recommended some great restaurants as well as made our dinner reservations. The hotel is located in Union Square. So, it is walking distance to the trolley cars and shopping. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: planeman
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend at the Pan Pacific...The hotel's location is fantastic!!.. with walking distance to Union Square. The Hotel is very elegant. The rooms are large and trendy..the bed was wonderful. The bathroom was small with very little counter space, but it is all marble and very chic. The room came with robes a nice touch. The service was also very prompt and professional from everyone. You can park across the street at a parking garage for $28.00 instead of the $45.00 the hotel charges for valet parking. All in all I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I read all of the reviews in the Trip Advisor prior to my trip and had some concerns. My daughter and I stayed at the Pan Pacific Easter week, 2005. This hotel was incredible. The room, although not spacious, was clean, modern and the bathroom is incredible. The staff? EXTREMELY courteous, polite and helpful with EVERYTHING. The car available to guests is a great perk. I will definitely stay nowhere else but the Pan Pacific when visiting San Francisco again! Really!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious base for hopping around the city!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked my Pan Pacific stay as part of a package deal on Expedia, as I was traveling there for a conference at the Moscone Center. My friends came, too, and they stayed in slightly nicer rooms (and paid handsomely for them) and we all had a terrific time at the Pan Pacific. Highlights include a fabulous bed, a gorgeous bathroom, a quiet stay and very good butler service. My room was a bit smaller than my friends' and on a lower floor but was nevertheless very comfortable, even though the furniture was just a bit worn and the windows were just a bit loose. The shower was a little too tiny and didn't get hot enough for my tastes, but the maid service was impeccable and I loved the room. It was quite a treat to stay at the Pan Pacific, too, because its location can't be beat. Highly recommended if you can get a good deal on a room, and be sure to explore the neighborhood--it's very touristy and very pricey, but then you don't come to SF to save money!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for San Francisco exploration”
Reviews.Author: ksquare
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous week in San Francisco. The Pan Pacific San Francisco is a terrific hotel in a great location. The hotel serves as a great base for exploration of the city. You see, San Francisco is a compact city that is best explored on foot. From the Union Square location of the Pan Pacific hotel, you can easily walk to Chinatown, North Beach, and even Fishermans Wharf. When you visit, make sure to ask the concierge for restaurant recommendations. Although it's easy to find many great restaurants in San Francisco, the Pan Pacific concierge offers a variety of restaurants that tourists wouldn't ordinarily find. Example: Jardiniere near the Civic Center. The concierge arranged for an anniversary dinner for my wife and I. This was one of the most enjoyable dinner experiences ever. Jardiniere is not a tourist restaurant with a view of the city. Instead they offer a fantastic meal served by people who pay attention to every detail. One additional word of advice for those visiting San Francisco: Bring your walking shoes! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: I tend to stay at alot of hotels in SF, and I had always seen this hotel, and 1 day, decided to try it. The staff knocks you out......Very Friendly, wanting to make sure that you enjoyed your stay, and if there is anything they forgot. Rooms are nice, and a flat screen tv. I think what they have done with the TV's in the bathroom is a terrific idea. How nice to lay in a tub after a hard day and enjoy the tv. The resturant for lunch was nice. It's not a bad walk to the financial district, it took me 10 minutes and I sort of shopped on the way down.

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel I've ever stayed at. Once for my honeymoon last May 2004 and again this time in March 2005 on business. The rooms are spacious and minimalist. The beds are out of this world. The bathrooms are huge and include both a shower stall and bathtub with a TV in there to boot. Amazing service and a breathtaking view in the courtyard. The only downfall is the parking which is $47 a night. Then again, I got the room for $90 on Hotwire, so I can't complain. Overall, this is a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “great location; nice room”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: We stayed between Christmas and New Years. Got an amazing deal at Hotels. Room was very nice. Concierge was extremely helpful. Location was excellent. Parking was a rip-off. Park across the street for 1/3 the price. Also the front desk upon check in offered us a room upgrade - the "upgrade" had a view of a construction site. We asked for our Hotels room and it was a better view and just as nice a room (just a bit small). This is a great deal for SF if you get a discount room and park elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if I'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: RumRunner01
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's right in the middle of it all and you can walk everywhere. However, I was unimpressed with the service. I was here with a group from work for the Builder Show last June, but the staff did not seem very hospitable. The only person who cracked a smile was one of the doormen. Other than that, don't expect much hospitality or warmth. The rooms were very spartan but the bathrooms were magnificent. I loved having the tv in the bathroom. Plus you had a separate tub and shower, though the shower was pretty small. The amenities were really nice too. But other than that the room was very basic and dull. Did not eat at the restaurant as it was very expensive. For a great meal walk down to Maxwells for a great meal at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. My husband and I were from the San Francisco area and recently moved to Hawaii. We were back for the holidays and stayed here right before Christmas and we loved it! The staff were so pleasant and greeted us each night when we came in. We felt like they went above and beyond to be pleasant. The location is close to all, near Union Square and close to good restaurants. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel one block from Union Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Wife, Daughter and I stayed for 3 nights at the Pan Pacific in November and would rate this hotel very highly after staying at the Fairmont Orchid Hawaii and the Bellagio. The location is perfect for the shops (we found the Pier 39 area to be tacky) and the rooms are fantastic - spacious, with lcd tv, large windows and a huge bathroom with tv! We didnt eat in the hotel so cant comment on that but the staff were very friendly even though we were clearly one of the poorer guests! As I used tripadvisor to book all our hotels I thought I should share this with you - basically the tripadvisor reviews got it right in all of the hotels we stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific San Fransisco...a real home from home”
Reviews.Author: kristyann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned (10/01/05) from 14 nights at this hotel, it is not our first stay at this hotel, yet each visit is just a special stay.The staff are the most friendly, happy and informative you could hope to meet.The rooms (we received a free upgrade as frequent visitors) are spacious and very comfortable.The new flat screen plasma t.v's are excellant quality, as are the choices of channels and pay to view movies,also the BOSE radios are an excellant quality,being left on for you at a very low volumn,if you choose to ask for turndown, another free service. The bathroom is just dreamy,all marble with seperate tub and shower,I loved the miniture t.v. in the bathroom, a nice touch.The butler service is excellant and so quick to respond,with nothing being to much trouble.The location is perfect, half a block from Union Square,and right in the middle of some great theatres and restuarants,(try SEARS, just round the corner, to avoid the line of this popular restuarant for breakfast, you need to be there before 8:00a.m, but even if you are later, the line moves very quickly,lunch and dinner are equally as popular).If you fancy the theatre,try TICKET MASTER, located in Union Square for half price tickets,we managed to get tickets for every show we wished to see, all at half price.All in All an EXCELLANT HOTEL at the most excellant location where you are made to feel so welcome and everybody is so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location of the Pan Pacific was excellent; however the hotel itself was very mediocre. The hotel is pretty dated. The rooms are nice, but I've seen much better for the price (we did get a screamin'deal on Hotwire of $127.00 per night, which made it adequate for the price) but I would not stay there again for the AAA book prices. The hotel has no panache at all, it is a very sanitary, lifeless hotel. The staff is courteous, when you can find them. The bar/lounge is a joke, and it is so quiet in there you feel like you are at a funeral viewing. When my wife and I do go back to the Union Square area, which we definitely will, we will stay at either the St. Francis, Hyatt, or other which we have had much better stays. Added tip, do NOT eat at Asia de Cuba, which is the restaurant in the Clift Hotel. The food was extremely overpriced, $100+ per person for very small portion and no drinks, and the service was the worst service I have ever had at a restaurant. The food really was not all that good either, I would give the food 1 star out of 5--Panda Express has better asian food.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott San Francisco Union Square
HotelInfo.Address: 500 Post Street, San Francisco, CA 94102 (Formerly Pan Pacific Hotel)
